io.reinert.requestor

Interface RequestSender

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HasHttpSendMethods, Request, RequestBuilder

    public interface RequestSender
extends RequestBuilder, HasHttpSendMethods
    A RequestBuilder capable of sending itself.
    Author:
    Danilo Reinert
    See Also:
    RequestSenderImpl

      RequestSender accept(String mediaType)

      • header

        RequestSender header(String header,
                   String value)
        Description copied from interface: RequestBuilder
        Sets a request header with the given name and value. If a header with the specified name has already been set then the new value overwrites the current value. Null/empty values are ignored.
        Specified by:
        header in interface RequestBuilder
        Parameters:
        header - The name of the header
        value - The value of the header
        Returns:
        This building request

      • timeout

        RequestSender timeout(int timeoutMillis)
        Description copied from interface: RequestBuilder
        Sets the number of milliseconds to wait for a request to complete. Should the request timeout, registered RejectedCallbacks will be called in the returning Promise. The callback method will receive an instance of the RequestTimeoutException class as its Throwable argument.

        Negative aren't allowed according to XMLHttpRequest specification. So if a value less than zero is passed, it is ignored.

        Specified by:
        timeout in interface RequestBuilder
        Parameters:
        timeoutMillis - Number of milliseconds to wait before canceling the request, a value of zero disables timeouts
        Returns:
        This building request

      • payload

        RequestSender payload(Object object)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: RequestBuilder
        Input a object to be sent in the HTTP Request payload.

        This object will be serialized considering its class and the current content-type.
        If no serializer was found matching these two factors, the a exception is thrown.

        Specified by:
        payload in interface RequestBuilder
        Parameters:
        object - The payload of the request
        Returns:
        This building request
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException
